Name: TenBaylor
Title: Bombay High Court
Review: We walked passed during an architect walk where we met a friendly English student who gave us a personal tour, thanks Saatish!

Name: Twinkle Sonar
Title: HIGH COURT BUILDING
Review: It was great experience here must visit this place in mumbai. knowing about law court and rules helps to serve better in life.

Name: Albert Y
Title: Fascinating architecture
Review: A wonderful combination of styles taken to the extreme. Gothic forms mixed with romanesque and indian touches.

Name: K Bharucha
Title: A walk through Bombay High Court
Review: We did the Bombay High Court Heritage Walk with our guide Rupali D'souza from the Directorate of Tourism. Rupali was a great guide and took us through the history of the Court and pointed out the architectural details as we walked around. The tour was informative and worth doing. My only grouse is that photography was not permitted within the premises. Would have loved to take photographs of the architectural details.

Name: igolfCA
Title: Interesting architecture
Review: Still used as a functioning courthouse and worth seeing for it’s Colonial architecture. It was built by the British as many of the similar buildings here were. Grounds are fenced off, but it can be viewed from the outside.

Name: lislander
Title: Beautiful architecture
Review: Nice old building and it's fun seeing all the advocates rushing to court dates all dressed in black and white. Remnants of the British system.

Name: oldiesontherun
Title: A beautiful building.
Review: The architecture here is absolutely beautiful, a mixture of cultures and in Mumbai fairly well maintained.

Name: seeker_here
Title: Colonial Building
Review: You can visit the Bombay High Court (from outside) just to marvel at the amazing colonial architecture.

Name: Aadhes
Title: Majestic Colonial architecture
Review: This is one of the great buildings constructed by the British still being used. This was built about 160 years ago and still functions as per the original purpose it was built. On working days it is very crowded and busy with lawyers and litigants. If you are fond of Colonial buildings, this is a must-visit. Since it is a functional courthouse be decently dressed.

Name: Khmer14
Title: Interesting architecture.
Review: Very interesting building on architecture side.Located in the centre of Mumbai.Worth the visit and have a look around.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Architectural jewel
Review: City’s second largest public building, it was designed by John A Fuller. This iconic building features imposing turrets, large roof spans, sculptures symbolic of Justice and Mercy, aracaded corridors and a grand staircase that underscore its monumental scale. It Victorian Gothic building was opened in 1878.

Name: Peach P
Title: Lovely architecture
Review: This is a beautifully designed building and should be visited to admire the great architecture dating back to colonial times.

Name: njan45
Title: Great Victorian Structure!!
Review: This Gothic structure is one of oldest high courts established in India by the British. This 160 year old building is a major landmark in Mumbai.Public can enter and visit the various courts and also the High Court Museum.

Name: macedonboy
Title: A fantastic building from the time of the British Empre
Review: The Bombay High Court is a functioning court of law and one of the 3 original High Courts established by the British in the Victorian era. The building is a major landmark of the city and a nice example of Gothic revival. As with most courts, the building has a sculpture of Lady Justice atop the central tower where she stands on one of the octagonal towers while Lady Mercy stands on the other.A fantastic building from the time of the British Empire that would not look out of place as a palace.

Name: Daithí Ó
Title: A lovely building with incredible architecture!
Review: There are so many court buildings in Mumbai and even the name Bombay is a rarety, but this one has a viewing area close by to take photos. An artifact from the days of the British Empire, beautifully preserved and wort a visit.

Name: Vilaas
Title: In a Area full of Architectural Buildings
Review: One of the key buildings of Mumbai History & close to the Rajabhai towers,somewhat like the Big Ben.Very close to the Fort area & you can easily walk down to the Gateway f India.Also close to the Church gate station & the Bombay VT station.You can reach anywhere by train from these two points.Close to the Cricket grounds & Cinema theatres.

Name: Dolly A
Title: Still Standing Grand
Review: Did not get an opportunity to go inside, but the grand structure is mesmerizing and the surrounding landscaping is worth taking in... must visit if you are around in Mumbai

Name: Arvind Kumar Yadav
Title: Nice big Building
Review: Saw it from outside. One of the building in Mumbai with ancient structure. well maintained One of the tourist attraction

Name: StephenMann
Title: Falling Down
Review: This is a fantastic building but really needs so TLC, lots of the windows on the upper floors have fallen out and the building really is looking quite bad, you are not aloud to walk around or even go past the gate, can only view from the street

Name: Munish R
Title: One of the remaining place using name "Bombay"
Review: Whole reason I visited was to take a shot of old name "Bombay" and it was nice visiting this in real life compared to all the Bollywood films

Name: Hitesh S
Title: high court- law and justuce
Review: its High court oF mUmbai, beautuful sclputre,acrhitech, made bu the britishers, its law and judicial court, they give verdict for  legal cases.

Name: Sumitkumar_13
Title: Justice
Review: Bombay High Court located in Fort area is the highest court in the city for justice. Many important and historic judgments have been passed here.

Name: Jarhmanite
Title: Beautiful old architecture
Review: Not sure if one can just wander in without a reason... But since I had a reason I was there and the atmosphere was quite overwhelming. Charged with energy, lawyers of all ages and grooming were a sight to watch.Better still was the archietecture - fascinatingly study and anchored as one needs Justice to be, this place gave out a feeling of reassurance.

Name: Nangavaram R
Title: Magnificent Architecture
Review: We saw them from our side, very impressive building.  The Bombay High Court was one of the three High Courts in India established at the Presidency Towns by Letters patent granted by Queen Victoria, bearing date June 26, 1862. It was inaugurated on August 14, 1862 under the High Courts Act, 1861.

Name: Dragos68
Title: Strange feeling
Review: It was a strange feeling to be in there. In another country and court!!! The architecture is fantastic. No cameras are allowed. You have to leave the cameras in a safe but the mobile phones are okay. We didn't get the logic.

Name: Trish W
Title: Architecture at it's best
Review: Being a fan of "old" architecture this is one of the finest in Mumbai.  Pleased to see it is being looked after.

Name: surbg19
Title: Architectural beauty
Review: Bombay High Court is an iconic building in Mumbai. With its colonial architecture and imposing structure, it cannot be missed if you are in the area. Of course, you'll see the place surrounded with lawyers and some tight security as well. Visitors are not allowed inside the court. You can just see it from the road, while driving by.

Name: Steve
Title: Elegant and formal
Review: We actually saw both the front and the back side of the building (while taking a taxi to Crawford market). I knew we were in the lawyerly part of town when seeing the number of men suddenly walking the streets in black suits and white shirts with a particular style of white neck wear.

Name: Q7636OCalexandrem
Title: AN UNFORGETTABLE VISIT TO JURISTS
Review: With imposing construction, the Bombay High Court attracts the attention of all the lawyers who visit the City.The great detail is that, although the City has changed its name to Mumbai, The High Court has kept the Bombay name !!!Must visit, especially its interior.

Name: Hooray H
Title: A National treasure
Review: Another beautiful Colonial Building that must be kept in good condition.How fortunate Bombay is to have these wonderful buildings full of character!

Name: charoos
Title: Heritage architecture
Review: The Bombay High Cour building , situated in the busy Fort area, is an impressive building. However the maintenance is far from satisfactory. Furthermore it is generally over crowded, thanks to the battery of lawyers, plaintiffs, witnesses and the media. In any case it is not a tourist attraction and the entry is restricted.

Name: prabhavmusaddi89
Title: Wonderful structure
Review: We passed the court while going to marine drive, at night the court looks even more better and very pretty.

Name: Sunil G
Title: Good architecture
Review: Though i didnt go inside i went to the area to observer the architecture of the building from close range.

Name: Komator
Title: Very nice building
Review: The High Court is also located in the Fort neighbourhood. The building is really impressive. We didn't get in (I'm not sure if it's a tourist attraction), but it's worth walking around and admiring the building.

Name: Mooh11
Title: The British Gothic architecture
Review: We walking tour from hotel to Gateway of India, on the way I saw many beautiful building.Bombay High Court is 1 of them, I saw and shoot images from outside.The British Gothic architecture is beautiful and has been registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Name: GPaCalgary
Title: Another Great Photo Opp
Review: A very interesting and historical place. Judges enter from the front street and all others from the rear, in order to prevent bribery and intimidation. The security is high. Any attempts to take photos of the armed agents  in their posts will be met with very vocal hostility.

Name: Francisco A
Title: Tipical Architecture
Review: We see the Court from outside, it was a typical Architecture from XIX  CENTURY INDIA, it was proffussily decorated with indian characters, you should see.

Name: Firoz_kj
Title: Bombay High Court
Review: Bombay High Court is one of the magnificent structure create by the British it is one of the iconic place to seeBest time to View from out side is on Weekends during the day OR/AND Night

Name: USCKaboom
Title: Lovely building
Review: The Bombay High Court is a beautiful building in the southern part of Mumbai. We drove by in heavy traffic but didn’t have time to stop.

Name: MANCHIMASTER
Title: BOMBAY HIGH COURT
Review: Though Bombay is Mumbai the High Court is still Bombay High Court. British Architecture building a landmark of its own. Worth visiting but high security check. Law students should visit without fail

Name: Sharon W
Title: Amazing buiding
Review: We didn't actually go into the high court building but this building looks amazing from outside.  I think it would be stunning inside.

Name: gastronaut_11
Title: Impressive Building
Review: Architecturally interesting the High Court has a great position in Mumbai.Entry is not allowed, but the barristers, dressed in their finery are a sight to behold.

Name: Shoeb
Title: Nice architecture
Review: The buiding looks grand. The entire fort area is full of heritage buildings and this surely is one of the best buildings.

Name: Neri L
Title: Interesting place
Review: Interesting local court in a unique old building with old halls and atmosphere. Lawyers with special gowns. Let you feel the authentic daily life of locals. Let you feel the system 50 years ago.

Name: TeaVins
Title: Authentic
Review: If you are visiting Mumbai and have not visited our historic Court, you must. This court was built before independence and has been a landmark for history!

Name: raghupalat
Title: Impressive Stunning building
Review: The Bombay High Court is a stunning building. Beautifully constructed with carvings of judges and others it is most impressive.

Name: BomiPardiwalla
Title: Only outside
Review: its a rambling old time architecture, and good from outside, but dirty and filled with people who are with their lawyers. the place literally stuinks and total chaos.

Name: michalbIsrael
Title: A gem!
Review: Beautiful building, although we were not allowed to go in. The gardens seemed nice, too. Form the outside it looked intriguing.

Name: KoshRoy
Title: Bombay High Court , Rajabhai Clock Tower and Oval Maidan
Review: I visit the Oval Maidan which is surrounded by ancient Historical buildings such as the Bombay High Court , Rajabhai Clock Tower , Central Telegraph office , VSNL , Churchgate station and dew more . Very peaceful and Art Deco buildings in the vicinity.

Name: Darren H
Title: Not much to see
Review: There's not a lot to see here other than a quick look at the decaying edifice from the street past a few heavily armed guards who scowl when you take a photo.

Name: Anshul S
Title: Historical building!
Review: Ancient building from the colonisation era! Such an imposing structure. being a lawyer, I visit for work though not leisure :p

Name: AnkitJain1368
Title: Architectural building
Review: Bombay High Court is a architectural building built in British era. Nice building to see from outside, of-course not from inside.

Name: Kjetil F
Title: Nice building and interesting history
Review: We went on a private tour and the guide told us about the story of the High Court. We could not enter the building so we were only outside the gate for 15 min.  It would have been more interesting to watch the building from inside.

Name: donmountford
Title: Another magnificent British era building, still in use but showing a lot of weather damage
Review: We viewed from outside as it was Indian Independance Day, no entry allowed. I'm no expert but this building and many others from the British Raj era are sorely in need of restoration and soon. Looking around the city there are, I suspect, just too many needing almost immediate TLC. I doubt the money can be found, it would be a massive task and cost. I would love to see inside but the gates were always firmly shut, police in evidence. truly a shame to imagine that in a few years this building may be abandoned to the elements.

Name: pratiknruparel
Title: Great Architectural place!
Review: The building was built during the british era and now serve as high court for Maharashtra. It is a beautiful building built with utmost care for it's aesthetic appearance. Must visit place!

Name: Anchor Inc
Title: An iconic landmark of south mumbai
Review: It’s a great meet up place and the distance from it is almost equal to all the tourist spots. We use to gather there and move ahead for our plans.

Name: Vaidehi J
Title: Rich architecture
Review: The building is old and needs maintenance from inside. However, from outside, it reflects the rich architecture of olden days.

Name: LOYSON L
Title: Beautiful British era building, where major cases in India take place
Review: A must see on the Bombay itinerary. Bombay High Court is one of the oldest High Courts of India.. Its jurisdiction covers the states of Maharashtra and Goa, and the Union Territories on the western side of India. .It overlooks the oval maidan on one side and the flora fountain and the University of Bombay on the other side..  The decisions of this court can be appealed only to the Supreme Court of India. The Mumbai High Court has a sanctioned strength of over 90 judges.The building is of British era of Victorian and Gothic Deco design and listed as World Heritage Sites .It has a tower with statues of Justice and Mercy.

Name: ladyus3
Title: SOLEMN
Review: We dropped by the Bombay High Court on the 4 July 2018. We were with our lawyer that day. He was very happy when we stopped by to see the High Court. I took pictures for him as memory and he took lots of pictures from all angles of the High Court.

Name: robinsongreat007
Title: Bombay High Court
Review: Bombay High Court is look like a heritage.Very old building but attractive.Good option for selfi points near to garden

Name: Aman K
Title: Greatest
Review: The building of this court is quite old. This is the time of British rule. Its design is worth seeing. Especially for History Lovers

Name: Harminder S
Title: Lovely Colonial Building
Review: Unfortunately could not visit the place but had nice views from the nearby park where many cricket matches were being played

Name: s_ramsam
Title: Nice British era building
Review: This is a nice British era building which blends with the architecture of many such old buildings in the area.

Name: Jaya03
Title: A spectacular view
Review: I have never been inside the high court however from outside it is a spectacular view. People around have witnessed a few celebrities who were regular at this court. Nowadays it has become one of the hot tourist spots in Mumbai. The architecture is well worth a watch.

Name: Martin W
Title: Lovely building
Review: Saw this on our walk from Fashion Street to the Gateway of India and was surprised at how beautiful this government building was. Not sure if you can go inside but the outside of the building looks very nice.

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Title: Excellent Architecture
Review: Being one of the oldest high court complex in India, this Bombay High Court is more than a Judicial place. Architecture is really wonderful and in Gothic styled. Garden is good inside this campus.

Name: Sheana M
Title: Stunning
Review: We saw this as part of the heritage walk. If you don't mind the noise and dodging the traffic. This is a really interesting walk

Name: Partha C
Title: Bombay High Court
Review: Bombay High Court is one of the oldest High Courts of India. It is located in Mumbai, Maharashtra. Its jurisdiction covers the states of Maharashtra and Goa, and the Union Territories of Daman and Diu and Dadra and Nagar Haveli. The High Court has regional branches at Nagpur and Aurangabad in Maharashtra and ...

Name: DDR1234
Title: Awesome Architexture
Review: Fabulous building with detail to architecture, looks like the building must be in Europe. Nice garden surround the building.

Name: shurkem
Title: Grand architecture but need restorative work
Review: You will not miss this building if you are in Colaba area. It is grand, historical and a must see when in Mumbai.

Name: Peter1948
Title: Another British design
Review: This is another wonderful building dating back to the British rule and makes this part of the city worth visiting

Name: David D
Title: Another wonderful building in Mumbai
Review: Sunday 4th March and we were out and about exploring in Mumbai and we saw this most impressive building. It is situated just across the road from the Oval Maiden, the Rajabai Clock Tower  and Churchgate Station were near by.We were not able to enter the building but it certainly is worth a look from the outside.It is a gothic style building with a central tower and a number of spires. The statues of Justice and Mercy are at the top of the building.

Name: Sagar2307
Title: High Court
Review: Another heritage structure, do not prefer to visit this place much cause gives you a feel of the legal battles that go on.

Name: Ayse B
Title: Worth seeing
Review: One of the great British buildings in the city. You will probably see it when you are in the old city.  We walked around it. It is an impressive old building.

Name: saurabhsingh7070
Title: most crowded and worst place
Review: this place is crawled with criminals and advocates. worst place to even cross by. no water no foods for outsiders. you feel like unwanted.

Name: masrani18
Title: best court ever seen
Review: Bombay high court is situated near chuchgate station. Its infrastructure is british style and that's the reason it is famous. you might not be able to go inside but it's worth taking a look from outside.

Name: TravellerMentor
Title: Obviously not a Tourist place!!
Review: This is one of the old Building fort made during British Era now It is Bombay High court, It is in CST (Mumbai) and walk able distance from CST Railway station as well as you can go by Bus or Taxi too. It is place where Guilty get punishment and innocent get Justice , it is not a Tourist place but the view of the court from outside is mind blowing.

Name: VBaheti
Title: One of the oldest high court.
Review: Bombay high court is one of the oldest high court of India. It ia located in mumbai, Maharashtra. Its jurisdiction covers the state of Maharashtra and Goa, and the Union territory of Daman and diu, dadra and nagar Haveli. It has a old structure, close to churchgate station.

Name: Hans Beck Gregersen
Title: Wild place
Review: The day we were there it was open - you could just walk in and see the huge old offices packed with papers from floor to ceiling - wild that this place works - wallahs bringen in court cases on big carts and unloading them in the yard - fun place to spend half an hour

Name: Udit M
Title: Court
Review: Place is full of Black and white dressed people, and luxury cars, it is simply a court, an tourist might not find this interesting

Name: Janet H
Title: Amazing building
Review: Surrounded by armed officers all along the footpaths surrounding the buildings but the architecture is exceptional

Name: GordonW318
Title: A Building of Great Architecture
Review: This building beside a main road is huge and very distinctive against other buildings around The architecture is unparalleled.Not sure if you can enter this building as walking but from the outside gives an insight to the great architecture of this building.

Name: SIVAKUMAR S
Title: Colonial Building
Review: I dint get to visit the building though i get to see from little far, it is on the way to the Gateway of India from Mumbai CST.

Name: Sagar2307
Title: Court
Review: Old Heritage structure not very well maintained could have done better. One of the oldest court houses.

Name: simply-peregrinating
Title: Beautiful architecture
Review: What a shame you can't go inside, but I believe it is still a working building. However it is worth seeing from the outside, the architecture is stunning. The spiral pattern on the towers is worth noting.

Name: Jimmy B
Title: Wonderful architecture in South Bombay
Review: One of the most obvious evidence ofwhat british brought to Mumbai regarding architecture.The building is good but it's nothing compared to whqt it looks like at night with these colourful lights.Highly recommended totake a walk to see all these heritage buildings

Name: sid_ups
Title: A beautiful building
Review: This building has come a lot of times in Bollywood movies and TV. Many famous cases were and are running in this court. And best this is this is still having the old name of Mumbai called Bombay.

Name: PraikB93
Title: Amazing Architecture
Review: The high court is located in an ancient building. The building is beautifully built and constructed. If you are for case hearing, then your case no. will be displayed on screen with the room no. in which the trails will take place.

Name: Siraj K
Title: Ancient Place
Review: Best Architecture and Ancient Construct. Best place to watch for Architecture and Construction Engineering Students

Name: _imti24
Title: Bombay High Court - Judgment
Review: Bombay high court is a beautiful historical building. It is built in a large area. Church gate is the Nearest railway station. Even you may approach to gateway of India from here. Across the building have tight security will gun man.

Name: Pris L
Title: Bustling and beautiful Gothic architecture
Review: I managed to enter into the high court itself because of a connection and could see all the lawyers walking to and from their courts and having meetings in the courtyard. Although relatively small as a high court, the architecture of the courts is quite beautiful.

Name: Maneesh12345
Title: Best Example of Colonial Architecture in india
Review: A One class building located near Oval maidaan.. One of the Historical place nd highest court of Maharashtra state Seen in many movies

Name: Shiraz P
Title: Just A Court And Not An Iconic Place
Review: Just A Court And Not An Iconic Place. Its still active today. Why to go to courts. No use. And very boring place.

Name: s_ramsam
Title: Great architecture
Review: One of the majestic remnants of the colonial era, this wonderful building is an architectural marvel. Great building to see.

Name: salony s
Title: Beautiful architecture to see
Review: The carvings and everything are intact and gives you a british era feel to experience a different city culture

Name: sid_ups
Title: Beautifulm Building
Review: This a very beautiful and British designed that time building and watchable from the main road in South Mumbai.

Name: akshay_khanna78
Title: Iconic building
Review: Great architecture...confusing to figure out the court nos..aint no sequence followed, random court nos given. New construction at few places / changes in structure at some places take away its sheen a bit. Tons of files and papers rob it of its charm.

Name: yezadm
Title: Architecture marvel
Review: This structure was created by the British. It is an architecture marvel. The lights show on this makes it look very nice. It is a big complex of buildings.

Name: TuhinS
Title: The remainder of Bombay in Mumbai
Review: The Bombay HC court complex is not one but about 4 odd buildings in a complex. All most all buildings except one are over 130 years old. The architecture is quite predictably inspired by the gothic style..in vogue those days in England. There is a museum for the general public...never been there as I always been there for work. If u are nearby and are going around places in South Bombay you may have a look. Around the court is also a Mumbai University building of similar style

Name: degan
Title: Beautiful architecture and a nice place to stroll
Review: I did get pretty tired of all the colonial gothic architecture in old Bombay but this building is set a little apart from the rest and has a nice cricket field, running track and garden across the street so it's a nice place to sit in the shade or walk around a bit.
